main event: A witness observed two spherical objects in the sky near Troy, Ohio on September 7, 1961.
interesting points: The objects were described as being 'satellite-like' in appearance, with one object trailing behind the other.
The objects made a sharp angle turn and stop for about 5 seconds before continuing on a southwest to northeast trajectory.
The witness estimated the objects were traveling at about 50 miles per second and were visible for about 1-1.5 minutes.
The witness stated the objects' colors changed and that there was an effect traveling along the ground.
The witness was able to provide a sketch depicting the motion and trajectory of the objects.
